name: Hyatt Regency Orange County

reviews.text: My stay at the Hyatt was truly enjoyable. I absolutely enjoyed hanging out in the lobby. It had palms trees in it! The bar, coffee shop (star bucks) and restaurant all located in the lobby. Loved the pools and there's a great workout room too! It is very close to Downtown Disney. You could walk but you may not feel like the walk back, so a cab or a bus is always around. There are quite a few restaurants and sports Bar in the area as well. I even caught a bus from the A's Stadium to Tumecula, CA. to play the slots at the Puchanga Casino, had a ball. I would recommend this hotel if you are visiting Orange County/Disney!
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, great lobby!

reviews.text: At first glance, my husband and I were impressed with the hotel. We liked the modern touches and creative use of space (this is an older hotel that has been renovated - the huge glass enclosure created a lobby in an area that was once outdoor space).
reviews.title: It's a Picasso.

reviews.text: Our first room was a standard, king room in the South Tower (apparently the older of the two towers). Upon walking in, we were both hit by the smell of mold/mildew and stinky feet. We asked for a new room and they generously upgraded us to a king suite in the North Tower. Customer service was excellent during our stay.
reviews.title: Australian family of 5 thoroughly impressed

reviews.text: The king suite, again at first glance, was great. There was a large living area and a decent sized bedroom. Our view, strangely enough but due to the renovations, was into the lobby. We had to keep the drapes shut most of our stay for privacy. The bed was ok, the pillows were fantastic, but the problems came about at night when trying to sleep.
reviews.title: Our favorite for the Disneyland area.
Unpleasant odor in room! Free breakfast was "not included".
reviews.text: First of all, the living space of the suite was a bit stark, almost like the waiting room of an office. All night we felt like we were sandwiched between two lobbies. The air conditioner either was blasting freezing air or only cooled the living room. I slept maybe 2 hours the entire night. My husband couldn't sleep until the wee hours of the morning.

I've stayed here twice. The atrium over the lobby is beautiful. Rooms are a bit small, but everything was modern and clean. Bed was very comfortable. I had a minor problem during one of my stays. Front desk took care of it right away. The have an onsite restaurant, but I opted for room service. Food was tasty and service was pretty quick. The lobby is definitely a place to meet and hangout. People are very friendly.
reviews.title: Very Trendy Hyatt with a lot to offer

reviews.text: Location can't be beat if you have a trip planned to Disney. I was nervous that screaming kids would keep me up all night, but didn't have any issues with noise. And because my room faced the lobby and I was on a high floor, I had a great view, but didn't have to deal with street noise.
reviews.title: Renovation in Process

reviews.text: There is a gift shop in the lobby. They had a sale and I cleaned up on all sorts of souveneirs and even some jewelry for myself.
reviews.title: Would definately stay here again

reviews.text: Only thing that I have to remember is the self-park is a bit of a trek with my suitcase since it's a large property. Visit their pool areas. They're great.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel, good service and free shuttle to Disneyland.

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel couple times this past month. First time I received an unrenovated room in the South Tower. Its pretty average room. However, the new room that I received second time is up to today's Hyatt standard. The renovation should be completed within a year. In my duration of staying at this property, fitness center and swimming pool was under renovation so I can not comment on that (there's a temp one open)
reviews.title: A GREAT CHOICE FOR A DISNEY TRIP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately for this hotel we found it rather noisy. We were located in suite overlooking the atrium on the 5th floor, room 558. We could hear noise from the lobby and the shower upstairs was extremely noisy. If your neighbour takes and early shower it will be your wake up call.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, noisy plumbing

reviews.text: Other than that the hotel is located close to disney with great shuttle service.
reviews.title: good value with AAA card

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and attentive.
reviews.title: good mixture of business class with a family friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + clean, new room; price; location to Disneyland
reviews.title: Great hotel - definitely recommended!

reviews.text: - pizza in the TusCa restaurant was not good
reviews.title: Absolutely divine!

reviews.text: This review may be late but hope can help others choose. Our favorite hang-out is Disneyland so was looking for a nearby hotel. We were used to Hampton but considered exploring other hotels. #1 - with a little price difference you can get buffet breakfast. I mean little (you can check prices online and select the one with breakfast in this hotel). The other hotel had the basic breakfast which was also ok. #2-the room we had was comfortable. #3 -there is free shuttle to disney so you saved parking fee and hassle. #4. Check-in and out was no hassle.
reviews.title: Will go back here

reviews.text: We went to Disneyland twice this year, the second time with an extra teen so we needed more room than on our first stay...and we definitely got more room. There were six of us, so we booked a suite through the suites on sale promotion. As usual, (we've stayed at a few Hyatts) service throughout was efficient and thoughtful. Though the Hyatt chain can be hit and miss as far as the rooms and hotels go, the service is always great.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was huge. It was two bedrooms with a living room in between. It was clean and comfortable, but very office/industrial feeling.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in the OC, again!

reviews.text: The hotel itself is nice, and the restaurants are o.k.(just o.k.) Overall, it's a very good deal and close to Disney. I'd reccomend it simply for its outstanding value.
reviews.title: Nice, clean rooms but small

reviews.text: This is my second time staying at the Hyatt within a year and again it did not disappoint. We had great friendly service and nothing was too much trouble. We stayed in this hotel,not to go to disneyland, but to go to Ice hockey and see the sights of the OC.
reviews.title: Ahhhhh....Service makes all the difference.

reviews.text: We had a great time here. Very handy to Disneyland, the shuttle is excellent, always on time, nice drivers. We upgraded to a suite, gave us very reasonable rate as we were there for a week, it was great, plenty of room, the bedroom part closed off from the sitting area. We were in the newly refurbished area, North Tower, lovely, nice new carpets etc. they have done a great job. The restaurant "California Grill" was very nice, food was tasty, service was great, it was nice to be able to just go downstairs for a good meal and not have to go elsewhere if you've had a tiring day. The guys who help you out the front were very friendly and helpful and always held the door open for you which is very nice. All in all a very pleasant and happy stay.
reviews.title: Great spot, very handy to everything

reviews.text: Initially, I booked a standard room with 2 queen beds, however I received an upgrade since I was a member of their hotel chain. No charge for the upgrades, even in Las Vegas, NV. Anyway, my stay there was great. The 2 bedroom suite was the best I've seen ever. Stayed there on a weekend, no noise during my stay. However, Monday morning came around and construction going on in the atrium which was very loud(drilling). Upon check in, the walkway to our room was across the atrium and was closed off on both sides just a narrow walkway(really no lobby). Staff was very helpful. Ordered late night pizza from Domino's. Also staff helpful in finding a place to order from especially when other places are closed during the late late hours. Starbucks was helpful, plenty to choose from drinks, sandwiches, yogurt, pastries. Complimentary shuttle to Disneyland scheduled every hour at 20th minute and 50th minute. Didn't have time to walk across street to eat in restaurants. Parking fee is $15 day. Didn't have time to do anything else except sleep at this hotel. It's a shame we didn't spend more time in room, but loved everything about it. Hotel willing to make your stay enjoyable and comfortable. Thanks.
reviews.title: Great job on remodeled rooms

reviews.text: We just checked in 2 nights ago and will be departing in the morning. Just thought I'd give a quick picture of what you'll likely get at this hotel before I forget. :) We stayed in the kids suite at a wonderful rate because of the construction going on in the lobby. Best value by far that I could find, but now I think we'd even stay here at the regular rates. The staff is very accomodating. I asked for 3 extra pillows, 3 blankets, a down comforter, extra coffee cups and they brought me everything I asked for within 15 minutes or less. Except for the down comforter. :) The kids setup was fantastic in the "bunk room" with a huge LG flat screen in both rooms, a great armoire with a mirror built in (I used it as my mom vanity while the rest of the family used the bathroom. A microwave, little fridge with room for lots of stuff (if you're bringing your own food this is wonderful), and a littel pack n play for a baby, if you have one. Oh, and the lower bunk is a full size,, so you could put 2 litles down there easily. Decor was very nice, beds were awesome. Overall just loved our stay... and I don't really like hotels. The only negative thing I can come up with: the pool is freezing. No way is it heated. However the hot tub was quite nice. Room service menu is surprisingly limited... I hope they expand it once they are done with the renovations. Food was pretty good though. Does anyone else wish hotels would offer lower/mid price food for snacks. I sure would order more often if they did. Starbucks fit the bill pretty good for our snacking impluses. But again, the service was really good. Even when I called for 2 measly paper coffeecups for my in room coffee maker, they were very polite and responsive. More hotel chains could learn from this Hyatt!
reviews.title: Lovely rooms, prompt service, best stay at Disney-close hotel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shuttle service is fantastic... The walk to the ticket area is not bad at all and we always found a seat.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel with a Great Price.

reviews.text: Great experience!!
reviews.title: New Family Suite Beautiful and Free Shuttle to Disneyland Priceless

reviews.text: We (7 people) stayed at the Hyatt for 5 nights over New Year's weekend. When I booked the reservation I was informed that the hotel was under a huge renovation but we would be in the tower that had already been completed so it would not be an issue.
reviews.title: OK stay, but had some gliches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we found that this was not the case, that the completed tower contained only suites.We were told that we would be put in rooms away from the renovation and noise would not be an issue. My stepson called our room as soon as he got to his and the sound of jack hammering in the background was so loud that I could not even hear what he was saying!! I called the front desk and complained, but they could not move us until the next day.
reviews.title: Fantastic Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was painfully slow 20+ minutes even with only 1 person in front of us!
reviews.title: Way more than we expected

reviews.text: When we arrived they preauthorized all 4 rooms to my credit card, and then charged them to my card again when we left. They did not remove the preauthorization charges for 10 days!!! The best thing about the stay was the great breakfast buffet - good food and lots of variety, but I don't think its enough to bring us back again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay with a group

reviews.text: This property is undergoing renovations and is offering some incredible deals. The North Tower is totally renovated the vast atrium is still under construction. We were given our Diamond Upgrade to a King Suite in the North Tower and it was tastefully done in the new contemporary Hyatt style. We were not disturbed by the construction in the least and the pricing ($69 at Hyatt.com) was unreal. An incredible value that I can't recommend highly enough, I am going back next week!
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Room, a little dated original Hyatt Room

reviews.text: Stayed here for a conference at the beginning of November for four days. Beautifully decorated lobby and very easy check in late at night. Very quiet hotel even though there were lots of families with young children clearly headed for DisneyLand which is right down the street. Close to lots of kid-friendly restaurants. The bar in the hotel is excellent and serves the BEST mojito I have ever had. Two nights we went down to the bar for a late night snack, and were not disappointed with the quality of the food. We shared Nachos one night and fish tacos another night. Both were very well presented and tasty. Ate in the main restaurant once for breakfast only and it was fine. The food served at the conference on site was excellent. Pecan encrusted chicken one day with veggies on the side and an apple crisp with some sort of blissful cream inbetween the layers one day and a Cobb salad the next day. Easy access to the 405, 605 and 5 also. This is a great hotel for a conference and I would definitely stay here again for business but I would also come back for a family trip to Disney.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Great Location

reviews.text: I thought the rooms were extremely spacious. Booked a regular room but because this hotel has many family suites I was upgraded. The rooms are well equipped and comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful. Negatives: the food at the restaurants was subpar and also the room heat never would warm up.
reviews.title: Great family place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All round excellent hotel. Friendly, helpful staff. Extremely clean and well maintained. Food good and all reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Would recommend

reviews.text: We stayed in a VIP Family suite for two weeks while having to attend therapy for my 3 year old son in Anaheim. With 2 children under the age of 4 this hotel was a great choice. The staff (most) were extremely friendly and accommodating. The food at Tosca was really good. (Kids menu could use some healthier options) however it was great that they usually ate for free. The Brick oven pizza there was great too. OC was great. The kids loved running around and nobody cared as it was mainly kids there.
reviews.title: Practical with Young Kids

reviews.text: The hotel was clean.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Hyatt and loved it. The beds were the most comfortable beds in the world. The hotel was undergoing renovation but it did not impact our hotel stay as we were at Disneyland all day anyway. We had a room on the 10th floor of the south tower (the older tower) and it was very quiet. Check in was easy but I wouldn't say that the check in staff was the friendliest in the world. However, the conciere was very nice and outgoing. It was nice to have a Starbucks in the hotel to grab a coffee before heading to the park. Also, the free Disneyland shuttle was awesome. The next time I am in town, I will definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved the Hyatt!

reviews.text: Nice hotel with good shuttle service and I loved having Starbucks.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but pool too cold for children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is that they should warm the pool up to make it more enjoyable for familes, especially in the off season when most people use it at night with the cooler temperatures. I stayed in the past at other hotels in the area with much warmer pools.
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Disney Trip

reviews.text: I understand the parking fee, but the internet fee is annoying. Most hotels these days [even ** ones] offer free, high speed, Wi-Fi, internet but I guess they have to make money.
reviews.title: Complete Fiasco Disaster, Security Lapse!!!!!

reviews.text: The hotel had very clean rooms and the staff was very friendly and professional. The hotel seems well managed. Overall a very pleasant experience that I would recommend to others. Please just heat the pool up!!
reviews.title: OK Value

aka: Hyatt Regency Orange County Hotel Garden Grove
description: When it comes to hotels near Disneyland, Hyatt Regency Orange County is the ultimate destination for your getaway or vacation. Located just 1.4 miles from the Disneyland® Resort, our luxury hotel near Anaheim has shuttle service available to and from the parks, and is in close proximity to Angel Stadium, the Honda Center, world-famous beaches and many other Orange County attractions.
